conclusion: Velocity is inversely proportional to displacement, expressed as v = k/x.
Velocity at A is 4 m/s, velocity at B is 2 m/s, displacement from O to B is 2 m.
Solving for k using velocity at B, k = 4.
Using k in equation for v_A, 4 = 4/x_A.
Distance from A to B is x_{AB} = 2 - 1 = 1 m.
Time to travel from O to A is t_{OA} = 1/4 s.
Time to travel from O to B is t_{OB} = 1 s.
Time to travel from A to B is t_{AB} = 1 - 1/4 = 3/4 s.
The time it takes for the detector to move from point A to point B is 3/4 s.
